titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Adrienne Keriotis Dickos Papers, 1986-1989 CTC.2003.02
titlestmt.author: Christie Graci in August 2010.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:29:18 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of the stage notebooks of Adrienne Keriotis Dickos, documenting plays she managed between 1986 and 1989 for several theater companies in the Pittsburgh area. The binders for each play contain materials such as annotated scripts, contact information for cast and crew members, promotional materials, stage and costume information, and stage diagrams.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Adrienne Keriotis Dickos in February 2003.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Adrienne Keriotis Dickos is an accomplished stage manager associated with a number of theatre tours and groups in the Pittsburgh area such as the Three Rivers Shakespeare Festival, the City Theatre Company, the American Ballet Theatre, the Pittsburgh Opera, and the Civic Light Opera, among others. Dickos is a native of Pittsburgh and received her M.A. from the University of Pittsburgh.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Adrienne Keriotis Dickos Papers, 1986-1989, CTC.2003.02, Curtis Theatre Collection, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Adrienne Keriotis Dickos Papers, 1986-1989, CTC.2003.02, Curtis Theatre Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of eight stage manager's books with handwritten notations: three from the Three River's Shakespeare Festival (TRSF), two from the Pittsburgh Playhouse, two from the Studio Theatre, and one from the South Hills Theatre. The contents of each binder have been filed in their original order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the following series:
Series I. Three Rivers Shakespeare Festival, 1988-1989
Series III. Studio Theatre at the University of Pittsburgh, 1986

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Christie Graci in August 2010.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Three stage manager's books with handwritten notations from the 1989 tour of Hamlet, the July/August 1989 production of Antony and Cleopatra, and the June 1988 production of the Taming of the Shrew.

did.unittitle: Copy of Script for Sharon, Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Two stage manager's books with handwritten notations from the October/November 1989 production of the Mystery of Edwin Drood and the March 1989 production of Chicago.

did.unittitle: Studio Theatre at the University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Two stage manager's books with handwritten notations from the March 1986 production of Betrayal and the November 1986 production of Grease.

did.unittitle: Prop List / Costume Plot / Stage Diagrams

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: One stage manager's book with handwritten notations from the October 1987 production of Musical Feat.

did.unittitle: Musical Feat - Binder Photocopies and Attachments
